publication.abstract: Â© Springer Science+Business Media New York 2016 In this chapter we demonstrate the use of R Bioconductor packages pepStat and Pviz on a set of paired peptide microarrays generated from vaccine trial data. Data import, background correction, normalization, and summarization techniques are presented. We introduce a sliding mean method for amplifying signal and reducing noise in the data, and show the value of gathering paired samples from subjects. Useful visual summaries are presented, and we introduce a simple method for setting a decision rule for subject/ peptide responses that can be used with a set of control peptides or placebo subjects.
publication.title: Analyzing peptide microarray data with the R pepstat package
